climbs.name: One Eared Elephant
climbs.fa: Bolted by Lee Terveen. First Ascent by Noah

content.description: Hard climbing. Very, hard, climbing. Find underclings and two finger pockets...if you can just get past the very, hard, climbing!
content.location: 6th from the left-hand side of the wall.

content.description: Off-width crack onto a face and up to ceiling.
content.protection: 6 bolts to two cold shut anchors.
content.location: Facing the wall, this is the left-most route.

content.description: A hard-as-hell start, on blonde rock, leads to a hard ass middle section, on blonde rock, that leads to a bitchin' roof pull to a black slab. This one is HUGE! Be prepared to spread your legs and trust the rubber.
content.protection: Be sure to use it...and bring 5 quickdraws. This route has at least one fixed draw in the form of a chain.
content.location: 2nd from the right hand side of the wall.

Second route on the wall if you hiked up Trail One, glanced at the famous 5.9+ climb known as Totally Flaked and thought, "Naw...we should try something harder" and kept heading right. 

  But while we are at it, one should consider the following shopping list. Do Totally Flaked first and then go do two routes on sick, black stone on the far right hand side of The Head Shop Wall. If you sent all three of those routes on the Head Shop Wall you should really consider just hopping on Loaf & Jug because it really is a hoot. 

  If you hiked up Trail 2 because you were attracted to either Yippie-Kiy-Yay and you had someone in your party who really wanted to try The Joker, then Loaf & Jug should really be on your ticklist. If you are still in the need for that level of climbing head to The Read Light District by walking past The Gully of Biblical Proportions, The Trail of Tears Wall, and an easy to miss area known as Purgatory. Going this way makes this route one of the last on the wall. Easily identifiable as one of the least overhung routes in this area dominated by a large, bouldery roof. 

  Loaf and Jug actually has the same start as Naked at 7-11, which goes at 5.8 and is a better route than Fossil Logic. If 5.8 is feeling good then head right for Loaf and Jug or straight up to get Naked at 7-11. All of these equals a pretty good time.

content.description:
Did you find yourself Naked at 7-11 and decided that you need to tick a few more harder moves off of your shopping list?  

  Keep climbing past the first four bolts and chains of Naked at 7-11 and keep going for four more bolts until your shopping cart of desire is full, or you get busted for rocking out with your cock out. 

  Warning! The exposure on this route might cause shrinkage.
content.location:
Very left hand side of the Red Light District. In fact, it and Naked at 7-11 would be considered the very first route if you take the first trail up. 

  Middle of the Mohican Wall. Walk up the first trail and turn right. Walk for one more minute.

content.description: Stick clip first bolt and pull a reachy crux around the 2nd to the 3rd. Then it's fun movement on sick pockets and crimps to the roof. Clip the chain and pull up over the roof on jugs. FUN!
content.location: The left most route that has a perma chain. The routes to the right are Log Jammin 12b/c *** and Carl Hungus 12d ***

climbs.name: The Gobbler
climbs.fa: Bolted by Lee Terveen. First ascent by C. Baird

content.description: A long series of difficult to swallow moves at the beginning gives way to in your face five eleven climbing that can be described as sustained in a manner that you can feel all the way in the back of your throat.
content.location: 5th route from the right-hand most side of the wall.

content.description: According to Urban Dictionary, a Dead Parrot is a surreal dud, a con or a fraud. More than likely coined after a Monty Python sketch in which a customer insists a parrot that he bought is dead much to the pet store owner's chagrin. Probably has nothing to do with the quality of the route. GET ON IT!
content.protection: Be prepared for a difficult start, like the rest of the climbs on this wall. Stick clip...all the way to the top if needed. Bring 8 quickdraws.
content.location: 7th route from the left-hand side of the wall. 5th from right-hand side.

content.description: A nice steep slab route with some hard delicate pulls using finger tip jugs.
content.location: First route on the left side of RLD.  In Cronins book as a project.

content.description: This route sees far too much traffic and good times to be only three star. It is soon to be a classic, if it is not one already. Enjoy HUGE reaches on HARD TO SWALLOW holds that make their way up a BIG blonde prow feature. Scramble up some more blonde featureless rock to a GIGANTIC roof and DANGLE in mid-air using a slit crack and the right footwork. Invert your ass and heel hook. Grunt and grovel your way up the slab to the anchors. A BIG, HARD route that is guaranteed to make you walk funny the next morning.
content.protection: Bring 10 quickdraws. This route has at least one permadraw in the form of a chain.
content.location: Right hand most route on the right hand most side of the wall.

content.description: Big wall with a large crumbly overhang base.
